alert.note: Alert for Kent; Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 11:39PM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Rhode Island...Connecticut... Pawtuxet River At Cranston affecting Providence and Kent Counties. Pawcatuck River At Westerly affecting Washington and New London Counties. Wood River At Hope Valley affecting Washington County. For the Pawtuxet River...including Scituate Reservoir, Cranston... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Pawcatuck River...including Wood River Junction, Westerly... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Wood River...including Hope Valley...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pawtuxet River At Cranston. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding will occur along Pioneer Avenue, Bellows Street and Venturi Avenue in Warwick. Some homes are impacted on Avery Road and Wellington Avenue in Cranston. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to 10.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall early Friday morning. It will rise to 10.0 feet Friday evening. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.4 feet on 03/30/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1145 AM EST.
